result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J. Schewe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler J. Schewe

records.addlTxt: 1:56 p.m. Defendant Tyler J. Schewe in court. Calling 15cf79, 15cf190, 17cm460, 17tr704, 17tr2436, 17tr2860, 17tr2437, 17fo1057, 17tr3029. Court recites records. Defendant states he just got job over summer - works 6 days a week; DOR levied bank accounts; has collections. Brought $500 with today to get up to date. Court expects regular, reasonable monthly payments beginning in December, 2018. Adj. 2:02 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for April 29, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

1:40 p.m. Defendant Tyler J. Schewe in court via video. Calling 15cf79, 15cf190, 17tr2437, 17tr2436, 17fo1057, 17tr2860, 17tr704. Court speaks to record of payments. Defendant states his brother was flighted for life in October - saw judge in December. Would have made payment in December. Has been in custody since December 20th. Defendant has a job waiting for him at Rhinelander GM. Court speaks to defendant. Court quashes warrants. Adj. 1:45 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for May 21, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
Per Scott- in ONSO - WF added

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3:07 p.m. Defendant Tyler J. Schewe in court, in custody. Defendant states was in Koinonia and then back to jail on a revocation. Has been in jail since May 30, 2016; waiting on sentencing date. Court will review non-payment on Sentencing hearing for revocation. Adj. 3:09 p.m.

9:02 a.m. Defendant Tyler J. Schewe in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Defendant Tyler J. Schewe in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16CM62 (Initial Appearance) and 15cf190 (Plea/Sentencing). State moves to amend 15cf190 to violation of 450.11(7)(h) - Illegal Possession of a Prescription Drug - A Class A Misdemeanor - Granted. State moves to dismiss 16cm62 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Rielly/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
Court Costs - $443.00
Jail - 15 days (time served)
Jail credit - 15 days 
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 9:16 a.m.  Review hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

3:39 p.m. Attorney Michael John Rielly in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rielly statement to non-appearance. State requests warrant - Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 3:40 p.m.

1:44 p.m. Attorney Michael John Rielly in court.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rielly states Defendant's car has broken - agreement had been reached - Michlig requests adjournment. Bail continued. Adj. 1:46 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant called Clerk of Court at 12:15 p.m. Stated he is in Wausau and starter went out on his vehicle and cannot make court appearance at 1:30.  Has been attempting to call his attorney since 10:00 this morning. Transferred call to JA.
PC to Mr. Schewe.  Told him he needed to contact his attorney.  Most likely will have to call back and arrange for a VA.

2:07 p.m. Defendant Tyler J. Schewe in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig states offer has been provided - Defendant has fears that agreement will affect his employment. Michlig requests adjournment for defendant to provide documentation that agreement will affect employment. Bail continued. Adj. 2:09 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

3:44 p.m .Defendant Tyler J. Schewe in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Defendant Tyler J. Schewe in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

2:36 pm. Defendant Tyler J. Schewe in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint will be provided, right to counsel - Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond. Adj. 2:38 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
